dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Back in 2019, Luckin Coffee's third-quarter sales actually dropped to just $100 million—that's a 50% decline from the previous year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Back in twenty nineteen, Luckin Coffee's third-quarter sales actually dropped to just one hundred dollars million-that's a fifty percent decline from the previous year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Luckins stock was also powered upward by a company report earlier this week that its sales in the third quarter soared to $208.9 million, an increase of 558% from a year earlier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that's a huge miss from their earlier forecasts. I mean, they were projecting a surge, not a collapse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that's a huge miss from their earlier forecasts. I mean, they were projecting a surge, not a collapse.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And the stock took a massive hit, wiping out around 80% of its value since the IPO. It's trading way below that $34 debut price.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the stock took a massive hit, wiping out around eighty percent of its value since the I P O. It's trading way below that thirty four dollars debut price.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares in Luckin, which was founded in only 2017 and is headquartered in the southeastern Chinese city of Xiamen, have now climbed more than 59% since the company went public in May this year at a price of $17 a share.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oof, that's brutal. And it really hammered the founders' net worth too. Charles Lu's fortune fell to something like $500 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof, that's brutal. And it really hammered the founders' net worth too. Charles Lu's fortune fell to something like five hundred dollars million.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Fridays stock surge left Luckins market cap at $6.4 billion, and the fortune of chairman Charles Lu (also known as Charles Zhengyao Lu or Lu Zhengyao) worth an estimated $2.26 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and Jenny Zhiya Qian lost her billionaire status entirely. Her holdings are down to $300 million now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and Jenny Zhiya Qian lost her billionaire status entirely. Her holdings are down to three hundred dollars million now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The big increase in Luckins shares on Friday also turned Luckins CEO Jenny Zhiya Qian into a billionaire, with a holding worth $1.06 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild because, uh, just last year Lu was ranked number two on the Forbes China Rich List. People thought he was this unstoppable tech titan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild because, uh, just last year Lu was ranked number two on the Forbes China Rich List. People thought he was this unstoppable tech titan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lu ranked No. 194 with a fortune on the 2019 Forbes China Rich List earlier this month (see overview here).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but even at his peak, his wealth was nowhere near someone like Howard Schultz from Starbucks, who's still sitting on a billion despite his own dip.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but even at his peak, his wealth was nowhere near someone like Howard Schultz from Starbucks, who's still sitting on a billion despite his own dip.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lus and Qians fast-rising wealth compares with a fortune of $4.2 billion for Howard Schulz, Starbucks iconic founder and former chairman.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Speaking of Starbucks—their market cap is over $200 billion. Luckin's is what, like $2 billion now? They've got a long, long way to go.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Speaking of Starbucks-their market cap is over two hundred dollars billion. Luckin's is what, like two dollars billion now? They've got a long, long way to go.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To be sure, Luckin still has a long way to go overall in matching Starbucks, whose market cap of nearly $100 billion and global presence tower above Luckins.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And you know what's interesting? Despite all the turmoil, they didn't close any stores. Still operating those 1,189 locations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And you know what's interesting? Despite all the turmoil, they didn't close any stores. Still operating those eleven eighty nine locations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Luckin by the end of the third quarter had 3,680 stores compared with 1,189 a year earlier.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So the footprint's the same, but the sales just… cratered. They did turn a small profit though—$10 million last quarter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So the footprint's the same, but the sales just... cratered. They did turn a small profit though-ten dollars million last quarter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Luckin is also struggling to make money its loss widened in the third quarter to $82 million (see details here).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a tiny silver lining in what's otherwise been a pretty disastrous run for them lately.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a tiny silver lining in what's otherwise been a pretty disastrous run for them lately.

HostB: Speaking of Starbucks—their market cap is over $200 billion. Luckin’s is what, like $2 billion now? They’ve got a long, long way to go.
